document-type.name: page
document-type.description: An ordinary web page. The content is in XHTML plus an extension XML. Documents of this type are used to implement auxiliary pages like the start page, framesets, etc.

document-type.name: xsl_stylesheet
document-type.no-refs-to: course, course_section, worksheet, generic_summary,summary, element,generic_element, subelement,generic_subelement, problem,generic_problem
document-type.description: An XSL stylesheet. The content is in XSLT plus an extension XML.

document-type.name: css_stylesheet
document-type.no-refs-to: course, course_section, worksheet, generic_summary,summary, element,generic_element, subelement,generic_subelement, problem,generic_problem
document-type.description: A CSS stylesheet. The content is XML (it is translated on-the-fly to the actual CSS format when the stylesheet is requestet).

document-type.name: js_lib
document-type.description: A JavaScript library. The content is XML (it is translated on-the-fly to the actual JavaScript code when the library is requestet).

document-type.name: image
document-type.description: An image. The content is binary (the image data) and may be in any of the following farmats: PNG, JPEG, GIF, TIFF (the Mumie administrator can add more when the server is installed).

document-type.name: applet
document-type.description: A Java-Applet. The content is binary; it is a Jar archive containing the applet class file, perhaps class files needed by the applet, and supplementary resources like property files.

document-type.name: jar
document-type.description: A Jar archive. The content is binary (the jar file).

document-type.name: java_class
document-type.description: A single java class. The content is the class file. Documents of this type are used to implement correctors for problems.

document-type.name: flash
document-type.description: A Flash movie. The content is binary (the '*.fla' file).

document-type.name: sound
document-type.description: An audio document. The content is binary (the sound data) and may be in the formats MPEG or WAF (the administrator can add more formats at build-time of the Mumie server).

document-type.name: movie
document-type.description: An video document. The content is binary (the video data).

document-type.name: element
document-type.description: A mathematical content entity. There exist different kinds of elements, distinguished by the 'category' metainfo. Examles are: 'theorem', 'definition', 'motivation'. Elements are written in a special TeX dialect which is converted to XML by the mmtex tool. Thus, the actual content is in XML, created from sources in TeX.

document-type.name: subelement
document-type.description: A mathematical content sub-entity. Similar to 'element'. Different kinds of subelements exist, distinguished by the 'category' metainfo. Examples are: 'visualization', 'remark', 'example'. Subelements are written in TeX and translated to XML by the mmtex tool.

document-type.name: problem
document-type.description: A mathematical problem. This document type is similar to 'element'. There exist three different kinds of problems, distinguished by the category metainfo: 'applet', 'mchoice', and 'traditional'. Problems of the first kind are edited in a Java applet. Problems of the second kind contain multiple-choice questions. Problems of the third kind are not edited online; rather, the user submitts a written solution to a human corrector. Like elements, problems are written in TeX and translated to XML by the 'mmtex' tool.

document-type.name: course
document-type.description: A course. Represents a course as a document rather then a course as a organizational unit (the latter is representet by the pseudo-document type 'class'). A course consists of several course sections arranged in a net. The content is XML. Courses are created by the CourseCreater, a GUI tool for that purpose.

document-type.name: course_section
document-type.description: A course section. I.e, a sub-unit of a course. Consists of elements and subelements arranged in a net. The content is XML. Course sections are created with the CourseCreater (see 'course').

document-type.name: worksheet
document-type.description: A worksheet. I.e., a collection of problems arranged in a net. Three different kinds exist, distinguished by the category meta-information: 'homework', 'prelearn', and 'selftest'. The first describes a worksheet given as a homework to the students, the second a prealerning worksheet, and the third a worksheet with which the students can train and test themselves autonomously.

document-type.name: summary
document-type.description: A summary of a course, sourse section or worksheet. Written in TeX and translated to XML by the 'mmtex' tool.
